datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to preserving species, habitats, and global biodiversity.

columns.name: region_type
columns.description: Categorizes each region as coastal or inland.

columns.name: average_annual_temperature
columns.description: The average annual temperature of the region in degrees Celsius.

columns.name: species_diversity
columns.description: A measure of species diversity in each region.

columns.name: employment_rate
columns.description: Percentage of the eligible workforce that is employed, indicating labor market health.

columns.name: average_annual_humidity
columns.description: The average annual relative humidity percentage in the region.

columns.name: wildlife_policy_strength
columns.description: A numerical score from 1 to 10 that reflects the strength and enforcement of wildlife conservation policies in the region.

columns.name: population_density
columns.description: The number of people per square kilometer in each region.

columns.name: education_level
columns.description: Average education level in the region, on a scale from 1 (no formal education) to 10 (advanced degree).

columns.name: environmental_awareness_level
columns.description: The level of awareness and engagement with environmental issues in the region, measured as a score.

columns.name: infrastructure_quality
columns.description: The quality of technological infrastructure available in the region, rated on a scale.

columns.name: conservation_program_type
columns.description: Type of biodiversity conservation program implemented: community-led or government-led.

columns.name: average_temperature
columns.description: Average annual temperature of the region.

columns.name: healthcare_budget_per_capita
columns.description: Total healthcare budget per capita in the region, reflecting the investment in public health services.

columns.name: frequency_of_natural_disasters
columns.description: Number of recorded natural disasters like earthquakes, floods, or storms per year in the region.

columns.name: wildlife_sightings_per_capita
columns.description: Number of wildlife sightings reported per capita in the region annually.

columns.name: economic_status
columns.description: The economic status of the region, categorized as low, middle, or high income.

columns.name: recent_internet_promotions
columns.description: Binary indicator of whether there have been any significant promotional activities for internet services in the area within the past year.

columns.name: protected_wildlife_areas_count
columns.description: Number of designated protected wildlife areas in the region.

queries.question: Is there a relationship between population density, conservation program type, and species diversity in regions? If so, what is the nature of that relationship?
queries.true_hypothesis: In regions with a population density greater than 100 people per square kilometer and implementing community-led biodiversity conservation programs, the species diversity metric is 30% higher compared to regions with different conservation programs or lower population densities.
